Bearcats Star Braden Spurling: A Linebacker with a Mission
Braden Spurling, a senior linebacker for the SBU Bearcats, has transformed his passion for football into a platform for ministry. His journey began during a mission trip to Haiti at age 15, which ignited a strong desire to pursue youth ministry. At SBU, he has initiated team devotionals to foster spiritual discussions among teammates and highlight the importance of faith. Spurling believes that football serves as a ministry field where he can exemplify his Christian values and inspire conversations about faith. As he prepares to graduate, he looks forward to applying skills learned on the field to his new role as a youth minister.By the Numbers
- Braden Spurling went on a mission trip to Haiti at age 15 to explore his faith.
- He coordinated multiple team devotionals to support his teammates' spiritual growth.
- Spurling has actively engaged with his teammates at SBU, creating a culture of support.
- He will graduate in May and transition to a role as youth minister at South Gate
BaptistChurch.
As Spurling graduates and takes on his role in youth ministry, he is poised to leverage his athletic experience to foster spiritual connections and inspire youth within his community. His focus on commitment and relationship-building will be vital in his new position.Bottom Line
Braden Spurling exemplifies the intersection of athletics and ministry, demonstrating that leadership and faith can thrive in both spaces. His commitment to impacting others spiritually will continue to resonate beyond his college years.
